conclusion: The acceleration at any instant is the slope (tangent) of the v-t curve at that instant.
The curve for B is U-shaped (concave upward).

premise: The curve for B is U-shaped (concave upward).
conclusion: Its slope starts out negative at t = 0.

premise: The curve for B is U-shaped (concave upward).
conclusion: Its slope steadily becomes less negative.

premise: The curve for B is U-shaped (concave upward).
conclusion: Its slope reaches zero at the very bottom of the U (minimum velocity, around t₁).

premise: The curve for B is U-shaped (concave upward).
conclusion: Its slope then turns positive and keeps getting steeper until t₂.

premise: The slope of the graph represents the acceleration.
conclusion: From t = 0 to t₂ the acceleration of object B always increases. It begins with a negative value, rises continuously through zero, and ends with a positive value of greater magnitude at t₂.
